instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.U5701: What is U5701? this is the keyboard controller chip that takes the keyboard and trackpad input and turns it into a USB device signal for the machine to process. If replacing a keyboard doesnâ€™t fix an issue with keys not typing, check all traces between keyboard connector and this IC. This chip has programming so it must be replaced from a similar, ideally identical board. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.P5VS4RS3_EN: What is P5VS4RS3_EN? PP5VS4RS3_EN is a signal that enables the PP5V_S4RS3 power rail. When you see _EN in front of a signal name, it means that it is enabling whatever comes before the _EN when the signal is high..
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5VS4RSE_EN_R</SIGNAL> short
threads.message:
Have a a 820-000165 that had mild liquid damage on <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> specifically only on pins 12-16. Replaced <CHIP>U5701</CHIP> but no change. Noticed there is a 0.003 short on <SIGNAL>P5VS4RSE_EN_R</SIGNAL>. When <RESISTOR>R7551</RESISTOR> is removed the short is gone.... 5v is at pin 4.  As soon as <RESISTOR>R7551</RESISTOR> is back the short returns. Tried running jumper from <SIGNAL>P5VS4RS3_EN</SIGNAL> to pin 4 but short returns.

What to try next?

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 8.60V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> 5V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5VS4RSE_EN_R</SIGNAL> short
threads.message:
If you detect a short on pin 2 of <RESISTOR>R7551</RESISTOR>, which is 0 ohm, how can the short disappear if you change 0 ohm resistor with a wire (0 ohm resistance too)???
Please put a bit of logic when you work...

Remove <CAPACITOR>C8175</CAPACITOR> and check again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5VS4RSE_EN_R</SIGNAL> short
threads.message:
Narrowed problem to short on <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> When <RESISTOR>R8179</RESISTOR> is removed with the  other resistors are on board short on <SIGNAL>P5VS4RSE_EN_R</SIGNAL> is gone but <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> shorted.

Should voltage be injected to <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> now?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5VS4RSE_EN_R</SIGNAL> short
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5VS4RSE_EN_R</SIGNAL> short
threads.message:
There are few chips (apart PCH) connected.
Start removing one by one, <CHIP>U3510</CHIP> and <CHIP>U4810</CHIP>.
If still low, bad PCH...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5VS4RSE_EN_R</SIGNAL> short
threads.message: Darn bad PCH then. Removed all chips including SMC and still low value. RIP board
